Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I cant see your PR in https://github.com/jl777/coins

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: There is some work involved with listing, and the price is far less than most alternatives. There are also infrastructure costs (i.e. if you are not running your own electrum servers), so it is not unreasonable to expect fee for service and servers.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Once you have electrum servers up, the next step would be confirming mm2 compatibility by doing a test swap in CLI, and submitting a PR of the resulting transactions here - https://github.com/jl777/coins/tree/master/swaps

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Once thats done, you can do atomic swaps with anyone who activates your coin via mm2 in command line. Listing on apps using mm2 like hyperDEX or atomicDEX is another step, and would more likely than not involve some listing fee. You can always use mm2 to build your own app tho, and list whatever you'd like.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Personally, I've done work on a TUI which allows me to trade mm2 compatible coins like LABS which are not yet on atomicDEX (with others whom have activated LABS etc via the TUI or thier own scripts).  Repo is on git, and listing is DIY üòâ
